newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Fourteen dead as train hits bus in S.Korea.
newsitem.headline: Fourteen dead as train hits bus in S.Korea.

text.p: Fourteen people were killed and about 20 injured when a train smashed into a packed city bus at a railway crossing in South Korea on Monday, a police official said.
The passenger train bound for Seoul struck the rear of the bus as it crossed the tracks in the southwestern city of Namwon, the local police official said.
"The collision took place at around 9.00 a.m. (0000 GMT). The city bus was full as it was market day in Namwon," he said by telephone.
Some of the injured were in critical condition, the official said, adding there were no casualties reported on the train and no foreigners were involved.
The back of the bus was mangled by the force of the impact, which flipped the vehicle onto its side, the official said.
There are no gates at the crossing, where a siren indicates an approaching train, he said.
